metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1978 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the ssl3_HandleECDHServerKeyExchange function in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) before 3.21, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 44.0, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact by making an SSL (1) DHE or (2) ECDHE handshake at a time of high memory consumption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1978` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 44.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.21-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-1d - 2:3.21-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.21-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.21-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
